description: President Trump has withdrawn National Guard troops from Chicago, Los Angeles, and Portland, citing legal hurdles in his deployment efforts. He indicated a potential return of forces if crime escalates. The troops faced significant legal challenges, including Supreme Court refusal and federal court injunctions, ultimately leading to their removal from these Democrat-led cities.

Contaminated Indore tap water leaves seven dead, 162 hospitalised
description: Contaminated tap water in Indore, India's cleanest city, has led to multiple deaths and dozens hospitalized due to diarrhoea and vomiting. A leakage mixing sewage with drinking water in Bhagirathpura is the suspected cause. Officials are investigating, with financial aid and free medical treatment announced for affected families.

He also expressed concerns about infiltration and a "changing demography" in the region, while dismissing perceptions of organizational weakness.

title: Delhi doctor arrested for Maharashtra kidney racket; Trichy medic on the run

The illicit market saw transplants priced up to Rs 80 lakh, while impoverished donors reportedly received as little as Rs 5 lakh. Police have named two specialists as key players in the network, which allegedly conducted surgeries in Trichy.

title: 'Industrialist' scripts Rs 6,200 crore swindle with 60 shell firms
description: A Kolkata businessman orchestrated a massive Rs 6,200 crore bank fraud using 60 shell companies, with bank chiefs allegedly complicit.  Fictitious iron and steel transactions, involving fake sales and purchases, were conducted through book entries.  The scam was exposed after the arrest of a former bank CMD, leading to the attachment of properties worth over Rs 106 crore.

They highlighted concerns over minority rights and constitutional freedoms.

The memorandum also calls for a judicial probe into the alleged destruction of evidence at the chief executive member's residence.

title: Spreading 'falsehood' against Modi govt: Nadda hits out at Kharge

Nadda refuted Kharge's allegations on MGNREGA, economy, and environmental issues, stating the people have rejected Congress's lies in multiple elections. He urged Kharge to introspect instead of spreading misinformation.

description: BJP shared a video showing a woman and her family being brutally attacked with bamboo sticks in Uttar Bhangnamari village, Basanti block, South 24 Parganas, West Bengal. The main accused named are Jalil Laskar, Munna Laskar, and Arif Laskar. BJP leaders, including Amit Malviya, criticized the state government, claiming the attack reflects a failure of law and order and a lack of safety for women in West Bengal.

Head hopes to revive Ashes drinks tradition with Eng; why it broke down in 2023
description: Australian opener Travis Head expressed his hope for a return to the tradition of post-Ashes drinks between England and Australia.  He believes mutual respect exists despite past tensions, particularly after the Jonny Bairstow stumping incident in the 2023 series. Head looks forward to sharing a beer, highlighting the positive relationships between players on both sides.

title: Trump's return, PM Modi's carpool & Pikachu: Images that defined world politics in 2025
description: 2025 was dominated by Donald Trump's return to the White House, with striking photographs capturing his inauguration and key diplomatic encounters. The year also saw significant moments like Trudeau's resignation, hostage releases, protests in Nepal, and strategic alliances forming between global leaders.

title: From memes to movements: How 2025 became the year of political awakening for Gen Z
description: What began as side-eyeing governments for being “pompous in power” escalated into calling them out, loudly and publicly. From campus corridors to capital streets, the Gen Z, largely mistaken as the “nonchalants,” made it clear they were no longer willing to cope, stay low-key, or wait their turn. Across countries, young people discovered that turning up in person still mattered. That streets were not obsolete.

title: Neuralink and parenting: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang on kids; will wait until Neuralink advances
description: Meta's AI head, Alexandr Wang, revealed he will delay having children until advanced brain-computer interface (BCI) technology like Neuralink is widely available. Wang believes children's early neuroplasticity offers a prime window for intuitive BCI integration, potentially enabling future generations to learn and utilize superintelligence tools more effectively than adults.

title: Aadhaar–PAN linking deadline ends today: How to link, penalty and other details
description: Linking your PAN card with Aadhaar is crucial to avoid penalties. The Income Tax department's portal guides you through a simple online process involving your PAN and Aadhaar numbers, followed by an OTP verification. Failure to link by December 31, 2025, will render your PAN inoperative, impacting tax refunds and leading to higher tax deductions and collections.
